issues.description: Constructor parameter mismatch between the example instantiations in the template Main.java and the intended class design shown in the UML and implemented in the solution. The template's commented example in template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Main.java constructs Seal, Pig, and Goat with two arguments (e.g. new Seal("Clarabelle", "marine")). The UML and problem text define Animal with a single attribute name (and tasks say constructors should initialize class attributes), and the solution implements single-argument constructors (e.g. Seal(String name), Pig(String name), Goat(String name)). This discrepancy can cause confusion and compilation errors if students try to reuse the template's example code as-is.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the example instantiations in template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Main.java to match the intended single-argument constructors (use new Seal("Clarabelle"), new Pig("Doodle"), new Goat("Buttinsky")). Alternatively, if the design really requires a second attribute (e.g. habitat), update the UML, problem text, and solution to include that field and add matching constructors and getters/setters. The simpler fix is to change the template example to use single-argument constructors so it matches the UML and solution.
